questions.question: What is Azure Active Directory?
questions.fact: Azure Active Directory (AD) is a cloud-based identity service. It contains all functionality needed to manage identities for a company.

questions.question: What constitutes the common principles used to define a security posture? Commonly known as CIA.
questions.fact: Confidentiality - Principle of least privilege. Integrity - The prevention of unauthorized changes to information at rest or in transit. Availability - Ensure services are available to authorized users.

questions.question: When developing cloud applications, the cloud provider will take care of all security concerns?
questions.fact: False. Moving to the cloud does offload some responsibilities to the cloud provider, but a model of shared responsibility is still in effect.
